entries.meaning: A French liqueur made at Poissy in north central France from brandy and flavoured with almonds and the pits of apricots. [from 18th c.]
examples: His coffee was excellent, and then came a case of liqueurs, noyau both white and red, etc.

entries.meaning: (ethology) A small nucleus or core group of people or animals. [from 20th c.]
examples: Borders are violated by hungering males and famished females, and the ordered animosities of the noyau give way to a saturnalia of sexual adventure.
